item.title: Amy add a quote by J. R. Ward
item.description: "Butch tightened his grip on his cell and wished there were an app that let you reach through a phone and bitch slap someone." -- J. R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description:
"I don’t think my sister is old enough to have sex.”
“V, she’s the same age you are.”
He frowned for a moment. Was she? Or had he been born first?" -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description:
"Whoa. Fangs. She had fangs.
She leaned in, prodded them a little. Eating with those puppies was going to take some getting used to, she thought.
On impulse, she brought up her hands, turned her fingers into claws. Hissed.
Cool." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "The half-human was the hottest thing he'd ever gotten anywhere near. And he'd cozied up to a lightning strike once or twice before." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Wrath dragged Beth into his arms and hugged her hard, talking in that other language again. When he pulled back, he ended the monologue with something like leelan. Beth: "Is that vampire talk for bitch?" -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description:
"I can smell the sex coming off you right now. I could take you down on this sidewalk and be up that skirt of yours in a heartbeat. And you wouldn't fight me, would you?"
"Now, we can be civilized and wait until we get home. Or we can get down to it right here. Either way, I'm dying to come inside of you again, and you're not going to say no." - Wrath to Beth" -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "If sex were food, Rhage would haven been morbidly obese." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "As far as he was concerned, there were only two good positions for a human. A female on her back. And a male facedown not breathing." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description:
"The front door flew open, and Mary shot out of the house, jumping off the porch, not even bothering with the steps to the ground. She ran over the frost-laden grass in her bare feet and threw herself at him, grabbing on to his neck with both arms. She held him so tightly his spine cracked.
She was sobbing. Bawling. Crying so hard her whole body was shaking.
He didn't ask any questions, just wrapped himself around her.
I'm not okay," she said hoarsely between breaths. "Rhage...I'm not okay." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "He wanted to give her another word to say, something like luscious or whisper or strawberry. Hell, antidisestablishmentarianism would do it." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description:
"V shook his head. “Remember what you saw in that clearing, cop? How’d you like that anywhere near a female you loved?”
Butch put down the Bud without drinking from it. His eyes traveled over Rhage’s body.
“We’re going to need a shitload of steel,” the human muttered." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "What you just had is nothing compared to what I want to do to you. I want my head between your legs so I can lick you until you scream my name. Then I want to mount you like an animal and look into your eyes as I come inside you. And after that? I want to take you every way there is. I want to do you from behind. I want to screw you standing up, against the wall. I want you to sit on my hips and ride me until I can't breath. - Rhage to Mary" -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "Being with Mary was different because...he wasn't the only one who wanted to make love to her. The beast wanted her, too. The beast wanted out so it could take her." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "Damn me to hell or take me to heaven, but for Gods sake, do it now...." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "You can fix anything but a blank page." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "Magic exists. Who can doubt it, when there are rainbows and wildflowers, the music of the wind and the silence of the stars? Anyone who has loved has been touched by magic. It is such a simple and such an extraordinary part of the lives we live." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "I do not feel obliged in my reading. I read to be entertained and to relax, and to go into another world, not because it's good for me." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "That woman doesn't have the sense God gave a retarded flea." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "Life is like a moustache. It can be wonderful or terrible. But it always tickles." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "I have no idea why it apparently takes three grown men to cook some hamburgers. One to cook, one to kibbitz, and one to insult the other two. " -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "A ghra. A amhain. My love. My only." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
Amy add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "Aren't most romance heros, or heros in fiction of any kind, generally superior to real men? Same goes for heroines and real women." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.D. Robb
item.description:
"For once, he slept first. She lay in the dark, listening to him breathe, stealing a little of his warmth as her own body cooled. Since he was asleep, she stroked his hair.
"I love you," she murmured. "I love you so much, I'm stupid about it."
With a sigh, she settled down, closed her eyes, and willed her mind to empty. Beside her, Roarke smiled into the dark.
He never slept first." -- J.D. Robb

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.D. Robb
item.description:
"You've got no sense of humor."
"I'm going to laugh really hard after I kick your ass." -- J.D. Robb

item.title: Amy add a quote by J.D. Robb
